title: When should I start ranked?
body:
Recently I've reached level 30 and I was thinking of starting ranked, but because I dont have 16 champions yet I have been saving up for champions but only the ones that I like that are more expensive, My friend says that I should start ranked straight away by buying 450 champs just to complete my 16 champs. I'm not sure if that I will get stuck in bronze from the experience of the game I have ATM or do I have to have a certain amount of normal wins to start ranked or not>
So when should I start playing ranked?

replies.body:
Just escaped Bronze, start playing ranked when you have:
**_- atleast 3 complete rune pages
- mastered 2 of your main roles
- know how to play atleast 2 champs for every role
- correct mastery pages._**

Good luck fellow summoner :)
Live and breath this post up here man. This is the perfect checklist for when to start Ranked.
Also yes... Masteries and rune pages but you head and shoulders over the other players that will be falling to bronze

Honestly, wait until mid season next year (at least). I rushed into ranked straight after I hit level 30 due to peer pressure, and I ended up in bronze V. It is way better to wait a while and solidate your champ pool before starting ranked. 

Before you do try:
* Get basic rune pages that are completely filled out*
* Make sure your masteries don't suck*
** Be able to play every role** - I cannot stress this one enough
**Be able to play more than one champ in each role**  - or you will get screwed over so hard.

This, I waited a year and placed in silver... IRL friends dived right in and they are still slowly pulling out of bronze and I have rushed to gold.

Tip: Ask a highish elo player (high silver at least) to duo with you/1v1 and they will be able to let you know how good you are

Most People are to excited to play ranked and play it straight away. 
I know its a drag to not play ranked and just wait, but please do NOT play ranked until you have decent rune pages for AP and AD champs and know to at least play 2 champions for each lane for example.

Top: Fighter and a Tank (know to play a tank and fighter top so u get both aspects of how to play top)
Mid:Mage and Assassin
Adc:Basically just a AD Long range champ but atleast know to play 3 champs on this role
Supp:Tank and a Squishy Champ

Get advice to make your masteries and make sure they are good enough.

Lastly, when you have won more games then loss on your ratio GO FOR IT MAN

Practice in normals. Record your games and look what your doing wrong (op.gg, replay.gg, lolreplay). Fix these mistakes to the best of your ability and then start ranked - you'll be playing against bronze / silver level players anyways, so theres no issue playing against these people if you were just going to get chucked in the anyways - then make sure you look at what you did right/wrong in your wins and what you did right/wrong in your losses. You should easily get up to gold and most likely platnium. i mean, i started doing that this season and i went from like bronze 3 to gold 2 if thats something to go by.

overwolf is extremely useful for this, is has stat features, records the 15 sec before your death to help show what you did wrong, so you can watch and learn while your down, monitors computer performance, and all of the apps on it are (allegedly) approved by riot
Don't play for a bit, get a higher level player to coach you casually. Enjoy silver and up a few months down the track
(imo silver is worse than bronze, they think they are "so good" then make so many mistakes and feed, trying to "show off", at least bronze can listen to strategic advice)

This guy has got the right idea

> Before you do try:
_Get basic rune pages that are completely filled out
Make sure your masteries don't suck
Be able to play every role - I cannot stress this one enough
Be able to play more than one champ in each role - or you will get screwed over so hard._

I checked out your rune pages and you seem to be on the right track. Just make sure you get an AP or Tank one as well.

Your masteries are a little dodgy though. Although at this point it's useless to change it since everything will be reset in 9 days. I recommend looking up new guides in the pre-season for each of your mains and seeing what works best in terms of masteries.

Masteries are getting completely changed next season, so my advice is don't play ranked until next season. You can, however, if you just want a feel for how ranked is and aren't too serious about it right now. If you really want a feel of ranked, play in the preseason to get your MMR higher for next season ranked, and go full tryhard from there :)
i'm liking that sound of the damage ones

you got 7 days till the end of ranked for a few months or so

just go for it this season, try and get a rank for the icons (they look decent this year(unlike last year)) then wait a little and get a better pool next season

start ranked as soon as you have the champions you want to play with complete rune pages because regardless of how good you are youll get placed where you belong.

Hey good question :). People has lots of different opinions when it comes to ranked / starting ranked. It good that you want to save for champions you like but at the same time in ranked the champions you like might be banned or will not be suitable for the lane you get put in / choose. In ranked many people are toxic and usually flame you for everything wrong you do and people at to very seriously / too seriously at times. So expect alot of flamers :(.  Other then that try cooperate with your team even though sometimes it will be hard and you might have to do things you dont want to (being left with a lane you dont want) and just try your best :). I belive you should start playing ranked as soon as you like since it isnt "much" different then a normal game of league, you also can get a taste of what ranked feels like and see if you want to keep playing it or have a break until you get better.

Best of luck
